info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 10:46AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR REDUCED VISIBILITY AND SNOW- COVERED ROADWAYS LATE THIS MORNING INTO THIS AFTERNOON... WEATHER... * West winds around 20 mph gusting to 40 mph will result in blowing snow across the region. * Accumulations ranging from a half inch to 2 inches will be possible through this afternoon as lake effect snow showers work across the area. * Air temperatures will remain in the mid 20s. IMPACTS... * Blowing snow may lead to localized whiteout conditions. Rapid fluctuations of visibility will occur. * The west winds may lead to drifting of snow on north to south orientated roadways particularly in locations with open exposure. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Localized means the effects of the blowing snow will be limited to a comparatively small area influenced by local terrain. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for variable driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
